title: Luyia - John (Book)
description: Luhya is a Bantu language of western Kenya. The various Luhya tribes speak several related languages and dialects, though some of them are no closer to each other than they are to neighboring non-Luhya languages. For example, the Bukusu people are ethnically Luhya, but the Bukusu dialect is a variety of Masaba.

language.name: Bukusu
language.area: Western Province, Bungoma District, Mt. Elgon.
